alert.note: Alert for Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ulster County through 530 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Willowemoc, or 10 miles northeast of Liberty, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Phoenicia, Shandaken, Denning, Turnwood, Mapledale, Frost Valley, Big Indian, Oliverea, Chichester, Ladleton, Allaben, Big Pond Campsite, Branch, Belle Ayr, Seager, Pine Hill, Hardenburg and Highmount. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central New York.
